H1.body:
.akzaraja¦ (aks2ara-ja) f. born of letters kalAstvakzarajA grAhyAH paYcASa-
tpraRavoditAH I1s4a1nS4iPa. i. 2. 87.

.aKilasuKasAra¦ (akhila-sukhasa1ra) f. essence of all happiness
aKilasuKasAraKAnimiva strItvamupAgatAm…tAm…apaSyam Yas4asCam. ii. 31. 6.

.agastyagItA¦ (agastya-gi1ta) f. 1 pl. Agastya's hymns forming part
of the A1diva1ra1hapura1n2a [PW, MW]; 2 name of a sort of vidya1
mentioned in the S4a1ntiparvan of the Maha1Bha1.[APTE]

.agnyAdikAryatva¦ (agnya1dika1rya-tva) f. nature of being a product of
Agni etc. trayIvidyAyA agnyAdikAryatvaSruteH Cha1ndoUBh. 115. 8.

.atitikzA¦ (ati-ti1ks2n2a) f. impatience, non-endurance ativAdo'titikzA
ca…tAmasaM vfttamizyate Maha1Bha1. xiv. 36. 20; Vis2n2uP. iii. 17. 23; Maha1P.
34. 120.

.atiriktaguRaviSeza¦ (atirikta-gun2avis4es2a) f. a different special
quality anena na tato'tiriktaguRaviSezasidDiH Nya1ySiA. 260. 7.

.atilIQa¦ (ati-li1d2ha) f. name of an aspirate coming after s2 vivftaM
prati yA UzmA vijYeyA vikawAnanA.lIQAtilIQavidyucca Sazasezu prakIrtitAH
Ya1jn5aS4i. 146.

.atucCacCAyA¦ (atuccha-ccha1ya) f. abundant lustre itastato vidUratara-
caraccAzacCadamUrcCadatucCacCAyAcCAdyamAnamecakaracanEH…mahABAgaBavanErupaSoBitaM
rAjapuraM nAma nagaram Yas4asCam. i. 20. 2 (comm. atucCA pracurA yA CAyA
kAntiH)

.atucCamUrcCA¦ (atuccha-mu1rccha) f. intense or deep swoon SrIdattaH…
prasUtiduHKenAtucCamUrcCApASrayAM DanaSriyamAkalayya Yas4asCam. ii. 339. 25; mandaM
vadannevAtucCamUrcCABirAkulaH.krOryatrastEriva prAREstyajyate sma suyoDanaH Pa1n2d2aC.
13. 996; ApfcCya gacCati preyasyanyayA saMjYayA vinA.atucCamUrcCayAdarSi
svAnurAgasya cezwitam Samara1Sam3. 5. 443; sA…atucCamUrcCApagamAtsvasTA tasTO
kaTaMcana MalliC. 2. 511.

.atyarTAnurAga¦ (atyartha1nura1ga) f. great attachment vanitA janitA-
tyarTAnurAgAyAM ca yoziti AmaK. 2482.

.aDaHSayyA¦ (adhas4-s4ayya) f. i sleeping on the ground aDaHSayyA
havizyaBakzatA pratyUhanaM ca karmaRAM vEtAnavarjam…vratAni S4a1n3kha1S4S. iv. 15. 6;
Kaus2i1GS. v. 4. 9; aDaHSayyAM guruSuSrUzAM ca kurvan Kaus2i1GS. ii. 7. 21; trirAtra-
muBayoraDaHSayyA A1paGS. iii. 8. 8; agnInDanaM BEkzacaryAmaDaHSayyAm…kuryAt kfto-
panayano dvijaH ManuSm. 2. 108; Vis2n2uSm. 28. 12; aparyaNkArohaRamaDaHSayyA
ManuBh. i. 132. 8 (on 2. 108); Ku1rmaP. 695. I (2. 34); aDaHSayyAM naktaBojI
samAcaret BhaviP. 247B. 11 (i. 164. 83); Lin3gaP. i. 83. 16; aDaHSayyA KawvAdyu-
pariSayanatyAgaH ManvaVi. 181. 30 (on 2. 108) [aDaHSayyA mftO BUmiSayyAyAM
pitfkAnane Vis4vaPra. 124. 120]

.anaBiyuktAcAra¦ (anabhiyukta1ca1ra) f. practice of the unwise ana-
BiyuktAcArApekzayABiyuktAcArasya balavattvasya pIlvAdivizayavarRake vyavasTApitatvena…
idaM vyarTam Mayu1Ma1li. 43. 2 (on i. 3. 9)

.anavasitA¦ (anavasita) f. name of a metre (consisting of four
lines with eleven syllables in each) anavasitA nyO BgO gu zaqante
Vr2ttaRa. 3. 43 (F. N. 8); [name of a species of Tris2tubh metre con-
sisting of four lines with eleven feet in each, MW., APTE]

.anuvAdadoza¦ (anuva1da-dos2a) f. fault (in the form) of restatement or
reiteration kutaScitpratipanne punaHpratipAdane'nuvAdadozo mA BUt ManuBh. i.
21. 9 (on 1. 25); pUrvatrAsidDamityAzwamikasya plutasyAsidDatvAt tataSca pakze'nuvAdadozaH
prApnoti Pradi1. i. 14B. 12 (on i. 2. 17); PadMan5. on Ka1s4iVr2. on P. i. 2.
17 (290. 8); niyame prAptabADaH sidDasya punarupAdAnAdanuvAdadozaSca viDO tu
na prAptabADo nApyanuvAdadozaH Pradi1. vii. 225. 21 (on viii. 4. 32)

.anuviDIyamAnata¦ (anuvidhi1yama1na-ta) f. the state of being what is
being accomplished or brought about indriyasaMskArayoH parasparADipatyaM vizaya-
BedAt kIdfSaM na Bavati.(ganDajYAnasya)…kAryeRAnuviDIyamAnatAmAtronneyatvAt
Nya1yVa1rPari. 609. 6. [Page6-3176a+ 62]

.anyavanitA¦ (anya-vanita) f. Ai another woman, i. e. co-wife
anyaTAnyavanitAgatacittaM cittanATamavaBiSaNkitavatyA.pItaBUrisurayApi na mede
nirvftirhi manaso madahetuH S4is4uVa. 10. 28; Subha1s2i. 2010; Aii another woman
kasyAScidanyavanitAkarRABaraRAsaNgataH.vicCinnapatito hAraH kusumAYjalitAM gataH
PadmP.(Ra.) 103. 94; lIlAtAmarasAhato'nyavanitAniHSaNkadazwADaraH kaScitkesaradUzitekzaRa
iva vyAmIlya netre sTitaH AmaS4. 72; Ka1vyPra. 278. 3; Su1ktiMu. 67. 7;
karRottaMsitapadmarAgaSakalapratyarpitaSSoRimA PAle'smin suBagasya nAnyavanitA-
pAdAmbujAlaktakaH Su1ktiMu. 88. 8; manye tayAnyavanitAsadfQopagUQasASaNkayA vasati
tatra kftAByanujYaH Bhiks2a1Ka1. 7. 10; Aiii any other woman, cf. anyavanitAdurlaBa;
B wife of another person yat kfzRamanyavanitAkapawApahAravIraM vipAwya vitarAmi
raRe SivAByaH RukmiHa. 4. 16.

.anyo'nyahetutva¦ (anyo'nyahetu-tva) f. the state of being the cause of
each other, reciprocal causality yadyapyakzErvinA budDirna tAnyapi tayA vinA.
taTApyanyo'nyahetutvaM tato'pya'nyo'nyahetuke Prama1Va1r. 2. 42.
